Pasokan Viscose APR Semakin Dominan
06 Nov 2019, 11:00 by Tim Pikiran Rakyat
DENPASAR, (PR).- Direktur Asia Pacific Rayon (APR) Basrie Kamba menyatakan kapasitas produksi APR dalam memasok viscose untuk industri tekstil dan produk tekstil (TPT) di Indonesia akan semakin dominan.
“Saat ini APR yang baru berumur 1 tahun sudah bisa memberikan kontribusi terhadap pemenuhan kebutuhan viscose di dalam negeri sehingga angka impor viscose bisa ditekan,” ujarnya di sela RGE journalism workshop programm di Bali, Rabu 06 Nopember 2019.
Tercatat impor viscose pada 2018 sebesar Rp 39,18 triliun dan pada 2019 diperkirakan mencapai Rp 25,93 triliun. Di sisi lain APR juga memberi kontribusi pada kenaikan ekspor viscose. 
“Dari kapasitas produksi 240.000 ton, kami sudah menyalurkan 200.000 ton. Tahun depan diperkirakan kapasitas produksi kami akan meningkat lagi,” ujar Basrie.
Dikatakan di Indonesia terdapat tiga produsen viscose dengan kapasitas 800.000 ton. “Tetapi yang benar-benar melaksanakan proses nya di Indonesia baru APR,” katanya.
Industri TPT
Lebih jauh dikatakan dengan semakin besarnya pasokan viscose di dalam negeri diharapkan industri TPT terutama di Jawa Barat dan Jawa Tengah bisa bangkit lagi.
“Persatuan Bangsa Bangsa sudah melakukan kampanye atas fashion yang sustainable melalui viscose ini. Sejumlah designer juga sudah sadar akan pentingnya keberlangsungan lingkungan melalui penggunaan bahan yang ramah lingkungan. Ini menjadi momen untuk industri TPT melakukan reborn,” paparnya.
Dikatakan, APR sebagai industri pemasok viscose juga terus berupaya untuk membantu industri TPT. “Pasar kita terbesar di Jabar dan Jateng. Kita berusaha merangkul semua pelaku industri, perbankan, dan pemerintah untuk mari duduk bersama menghidupka kembali TPT,” katanya.
Berkaitan dengan itu, APR juga membuat sebuah komitmen riset dan pengembangan dengan mengalokasikan dana sebesar USD 200 juta selama 10 tahun ke depan.
“Kita juga akan membangun sebuah hub yang akan mempertemukan pabrikan, industri, designer dan media fashion berupa gedung creative centre di Jakarta,” katanya.
Hub ini juga nantinya yang akan menjembatani industri dengan UKM. “Seperti misalnya minimum order. Kita akan menyediakan bahan untuk bisa dibeli secara retail misalnya 300 meter. Selain itu kita juga bekerjasama dengan Kementerian Perindustrian untuk bisa membeti stimulus,” katanya. (Dadang Hermawan/”PR”)***

Viscose APR supply is increasingly dominant
Nov 6 2019, 11:00 by People's Mind Team
DENPASAR, (PR) .- Asia Pacific Rayon (APR) Director Basrie Kamba said APR's production capacity in supplying viscose to the textile and textile product (TPT) industry in Indonesia will be increasingly dominant.
"At this time the APR which is only 1 year old has been able to contribute to meeting the needs of viscose in the country so that the number of viscose imports can be suppressed," he said on the sidelines of the RGE journalism workshop programm in Bali, Wednesday, November 6, 2019.
Viscose imports in 2018 amounted to Rp 39.18 trillion and in 2019 it is estimated to reach Rp 25.93 trillion. On the other hand APR also contributed to the increase in viscose exports.
"From a production capacity of 240,000 tons, we have distributed 200,000 tons. Next year it is estimated that our production capacity will increase again, "Basrie said.
It said in Indonesia there were three viscose producers with a capacity of 800,000 tons. "But the one who really carried out the process in Indonesia was only APR," he said.
TPT industry
Furthermore, it is said that with the increasing viscose supply in the country, it is hoped that the TPT industry, especially in West Java and Central Java, can rise again.
"The United Nations has conducted a campaign for sustainable fashion through this viscose. A number of designers have also been aware of the importance of environmental sustainability through the use of environmentally friendly materials. This is a moment for the TPT industry to reborn, "he explained.
It is said, APR as a viscose supplier industry also continues to strive to help the textile industry. "Our biggest market is in West Java and Central Java. We are trying to embrace all industry, banking and government actors to come sit together to revive the TPT, "he said.
In this connection, the APR also made a research and development commitment by allocating funds of USD 200 million over the next 10 years.
"We will also build a hub that will bring together manufacturers, industry, designers and fashion media in the form of a creative center building in Jakarta," he said.
This hub will also bridge the industry with SMEs. "Like for example the minimum order. We will provide materials for retail purchase, for example 300 meters. In addition, we also cooperate with the Ministry of Industry to be able to provide stimulus, "he said. (Dadang Hermawan / "Homework") ***
